ProjectTitle: Development of a mouse model for Multiple System Atrophy based on peripheral triggers of a-synuclein aggregation and propagation.
InitialFeedbackHistory:
28/06/2022
Very good and detailed DMP. 
4. Metadata: OME-TIFF focuses on microscopy, this may not be very suitable for western blots and gels. For rtPCR you can take a look if you find MIQE useful (https://fairsharing.org/FAIRsharing.mxz4jy). Also take a look at the arrive guidelines for reporting of animal experiments since many journals ask to follow these (https://arriveguidelines.org/) 
7. Have you considered using any specific repositories for data sharing? Would IDR (https://idr.openmicroscopy.org/) or EBI (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/submission/) for example be suitable? Alternatively you can the KU Leuven data repository RDR (www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr) where you can also restrict access to files or apply embargo if needed.
label: good with suggestions
